children.subject: also keep on mind: 16b and 70 both have heavy weekly problem sets. Personally I found ee16b to be not very conceptually difficult, but actually a ton of work and took up way more time than I expected due to the sheer amount of class time
i think that is too much. i think 61b 70 r4b would be a great workload. dropping ee16b and not taking it this fall also sounds like a good choice

history.content:
I took CS61B, CS70, and EE16B during Spring 18, my second semester freshman year.
I have to say, the workload is INTENSE. There will be no week where you are “free.” I would highly reconsider taking all three classes at once, because especially I would assume you want to recruit for internships in the fall, so you will need some time for that.

61B projects are major time chunks, 70 has weekly problem sets that also take a good amount of time, and 16B ALSO has weekly problem sets that take long time (especially recently from what I heard, they got longer)

If you’re undeclared CS, just drop 16B and take it your final semester at Berkeley or something

--

I know several people who did this last semester and did well with it. If you comfortably got As/A+es in 16a and 61a I'd recommend it. If 70 "clicks" for you, you'll probably find 16b to be by far the most time consuming class. Replacing 16b with some other comparably difficult but less time-consuming class will probably make your semester a lot nicer. That's what I did (with stat 134, though the redundancy of that class with the second half of 70 made the schedule easier as well) and I found it not much harder than 16a/61a honestly.

children.subject: I took 61B, 70, 16B last fall and had to end up dropping 16B midsemester due to the intense workload. If you're CS and need to declare, definitely do not recommend taking all 3.

I'm gonna take another side on this one and say go for it. Since you say you did well in 61A and 16A (I'm assuming A/A+) I think you will be able to handle these classes. It'll probably be a very intense semester however, but if you like math then this will be fun. Good luck
Go for it. It's going to be a very difficult courseload, but people have done it before and did decently well.
Dropping 16b may not be a bad choice to focus on other classes. Added bonus is that there are better professors Spring 2020.
No, no, no, don’t do that. It also largely depends on who is teaching it. Check it out...
Don't do it! 16B will consume your life.

history.content:
Hey, I'm a rising sophomore who did well in 61A and 16A, looking for some course advice.

As of now, I am planning to take CS 61B, CS 70, EE 16B, and an R4B class for the R&C req. I feel like it may be overkill. Can someone give me a workload estimate, tips, and/or suggestions. If it's too much, I would prefer to drop EE 16B so I can declare this coming semester. Thanks.
history.subject: Couseload Feedback (61B, 70, 16B)
